structure.unit: Courts, Judicial Officers And Proceedings In Civil Cases

law.catch_line: Sale Of Personalty On Execution; Costs
law.text: Personal property seized on execution shall be safely kept by the officer, at the expense of the debtor, for four days at least; and shall be sold by public auction within fourteen days next after the seizure, except as provided in the following sections, unless the debtor before such sale redeems it by otherwise satisfying the execution.
